newsitem.title: GREECE: PRESS DIGEST - GREEK GENERAL NEWS- MAY 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - GREEK GENERAL NEWS- MAY 12.

text.p: Leading stories in the Greek general press:

--Reports have the Greek government prepared to consider US "technical proposals" to establish air corridors within national airspace for Turkish aircraft. The measure is considered to help in the development of confidence-building measures between the two countries.
--Prime Minister Costas Simitis took a unifying line at the weekend's ruling party PASOK organising conference, describing his vision of the PASOK of the 21st century.

--Fearing a furore over his comments on late PASOK founder and president Andreas Papandreou, former president of the republic Costantine Karamanlis has prevented release of the 12th volume of his memoirs before Wednesday's official launch. At ruling party PASOK's headquarters, meetings have decided that government members not attend the launch.

--Athens and Ankara are reportedly moving towards an agreement on overflights of Turkish aircraft within Greek national airspace. The reports have prompted a reaction from Defence Minister Akis Tsohatzopoulos who said that "nobody has the right to bargain away sovereign rights".

--New university entrance regulations will come into effect as of the 1997-1998 academic year at seven universities as the education ministry establishes "free studies centres" for some 3,00 students. --Maria Petrakis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
